data.title: Antonia Fraser – Audio Books, Best Sellers, Author Bio
data.meta_description: Learn more about Antonia Fraser. Browse Antonia Fraser’s best-selling audiobooks and newest titles. Discover more authors you’ll love listening to on Audible.
data.text:
The Lives of the Kings and Queens of England

By: Antonia Fraser - editor

Narrated by: Wanda McCaddon

Length: 12 hrs and 33 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4 out of 5 stars 660

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 514

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 513

This magnificent story of 1,000 years of English history is told through the lives and deeds of Kings and Queens...

4 out of 5 stars

Excellent introduction of British History

By Ian on 04-15-07

Mary Queen of Scots

By: Antonia Fraser

Narrated by: Anne Flosnik

Length: 25 hrs and 3 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4.5 out of 5 stars 108

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 95

Story

4.5 out of 5 stars 94

Her royal birth gave her claim to the thrones of two nations; her marriage to the young French dauphin promised to place a third glorious crown on her noble head. Instead, Mary Stuart became the victim of her own impulsive heart....

1 out of 5 stars

Shockingly disingenuous.

By rainjade on 08-14-18

The King and the Catholics

England, Ireland, and the Fight for Religious Freedom, 1780-1829

By: Antonia Fraser

Narrated by: Steven Crossley

Length: 11 hrs and 29 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4 out of 5 stars 25

Performance

4.5 out of 5 stars 24

Story

4 out of 5 stars 24

In the 18th century, the Catholics of England lacked many basic freedoms under the law: they could not serve in political office, buy or inherit land, or be married by the rites of their own religion....

5 out of 5 stars

Peaceful Revolution. How it was done.

By Albert C Reichelt on 10-16-18

France's iconic queen, Marie Antoinette, wrongly accused of uttering the infamous "Let them eat cake", was alternately revered and reviled during her lifetime....

2 out of 5 stars

Annoying Narration

By LaFemmeRouge on 10-28-06

The Case of the Married Woman

Caroline Norton and Her Fight for Justice for Women

By: Antonia Fraser

Narrated by: Penelope Milton

Length: 9 hrs and 26 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4 out of 5 stars 3

Performance

5 out of 5 stars 2

Story

5 out of 5 stars 2

Beset by the personal cruelties perpetrated by her husband and a society whose rules were set against her, Caroline Norton chose to fight. She channeled her energies in an area of much-needed reform: the rights of a married woman and specifically those of a mother....

5 out of 5 stars

Well told! Well researched! And well written.

The King and the Catholics

The Fight for Rights 1829

By: Antonia Fraser

Narrated by: Steven Crossley

Length: 11 hrs and 29 mins

Unabridged

Overall

4 out of 5 stars 1

Performance

3 out of 5 stars 1

Story

5 out of 5 stars 1

The story of Catholic Emancipation begins with the Anti-Catholic Gordon Riots in 1780, fuelled by a reduction in Penal Laws against Catholics harking back to the 16th century. Fifty years later, the passing of the Emancipation Bill was hailed as a 'bloodless revolution'....
